basics.name: Austin J. Hardy
basics.title: Senior Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Developer Productivity Engineer with 15+ years building AI-enhanced tools that empower thousands of engineers. Pioneer in MCP (Model Context Protocol) server architecture, GenAI tool integration, and AI-assisted development workflows. Expert in enterprise automation platforms, cross-repository technical excellence, and internal tooling at scale. Currently driving transformational AI adoption and developer experience improvements at Netflix. Ut prosim.

work.name: Netflix, Inc.
highlights: GenAI Tool Integration Pioneer - Lead contributor to Netflix Productivity Assistant ecosystem. Architected and implemented Spring AI @Tool annotations framework in Jirawala, transforming it into a sophisticated MCP server. Enabled natural language Jira operations, self-service project creation, user lookup, and issue management through conversational AI interfaces. Built foundational architecture for enterprise AI-assisted engineering workflows serving thousands of developers.

Developer Productivity Leadership - Operated and maintained 6+ production services self-service and supporting engineering integrations. Achieved 76% test coverage in legacy repositories through systematic testing enhancement and build system optimization.

Cross-Repository Technical Excellence - Established L6-level agent profile for systematic repository maintenance, standardizing build systems, pre-commit hooks, and CI/CD pipelines across Python/Java codebases. Reduced technical debt through automated dependency management and infrastructure hardening.

Enterprise Automation at Scale - Fixed Jirawala Slack bot enabling self-service Jira project management for Netflix engineering teams. Designed extensible command architecture supporting 15+ different operations with metatron authentication and comprehensive error handling.

Ad Ops Pipeline Optimization - Developed custom Jira project and automation rules for Ad Operations team, enabling streamlined campaign management and work tracking from Airtable. Enhanced visibility and reporting for $30M+ in revenue through custom fields, workflows, and dashboards.

Data-Driven Engineering Insights - Built Global Agile Dashboards using Atlassian Analytics and SQL, enabling actionable insights for thousands of Workforce Engineering users. Created bi-weekly sprint assessment automation for team performance analysis.

Cloud Infrastructure & SRE - Managed incidents and operational alerts with comprehensive runbook automation. Disabled hundreds of unused webhooks, cleaned up resource-heavy automation rules, and led Atlassian Data Center to Cloud migration for 5000+ external partners.

AI-Assisted Development Advocate - Pioneered Claude/MCP workflows for enterprise development, including bitbot for intelligent code analysis, automated testing frameworks, and cross-repository pattern recognition for unit test generation. Integrated GitHub Copilot into Slack channels enabling collaborative AI-assisted coding sessions. Built comprehensive knowledge bases and documentation systems with direct Jira integration, reducing developer onboarding time by 40% and debugging cycles by 60%.

Atlassian Informed Captain - Drove transformational change and best practices for Atlassian tools at Netflix. Championed product improvements, internal adoption, and operational excellence through strategic leadership, stakeholder engagement, and continuous process optimization.
work.summary: As a Senior Systems Engineer at Netflix, I streamline operations and automation within the Atlassian ecosystem, reducing manual efforts and enhancing efficiency for engineering and operations teams. I oversee incident management, drive cloud transitions, and deliver data-driven dashboards to empower strategic decision-making. By building knowledge bases, enabling integrations, and providing targeted support for major organizational transitions, I ensure that tools and processes align seamlessly with Netflix's dynamic needs.

work.name: Coinbase Global Inc.
highlights: Product Launch Calendar - Transformed cross-functional approval & rollout process for tracking features, releases, and programs, benefiting millions of global customers.
Rolling Intake - Streamlined IT Program Management with automated Insights self-service, enhancing efficiency for dynamic datasets.
MNPI Issue Level Security - Automated Restricted issue access for MNPI compliance across the organization.
WEB3 Demo to IT - Immersed in web3, completed Crypto-U courses, and served as COINbassador.
AUDIT-omation - Automated SOC & R+D Expense artifact gathering in Jira, supported $400M+ in refunds and time savings for tax and audit needs.
work.summary: As a System Engineer on the IT Operations Atlassian team, I oversaw the Atlassian Suite, integrated Confluence, Jira, and Jira Service Management, along with Third-Party integrations. I upgraded systems and plugins, ensured tool currency and site reliability. Seamlessly integrated solutions across teams, managed user access, drove agile automation, and troubleshot effectively. Dedicated to scaling, cost-saving, and inventive collaboration, I collaborated with teams for dependable support and clear communication while maintaining meticulous documentation.

work.name: Blackboard, Inc.
highlights: SRE for Atlassian Server and Datacenter apps, supported teams and CI/CD pipelines
Managed Third Party SaaS apps, assessed toolset for Security, Accessibility (AX), User Experience (UX), and Product Experience (PX)
Executed Atlassian Cloud migration strategy with Platinum partner
Collaborated with vendors for security and accessibility features
Removed technical debt: legacy integrations, unused licenses, 200 old projects
Decommissioned VMs, promoted AWS usage, eliminated toil and blockers
Led Jira SAFe transformation, integrated Jira Align across PDD programs
Standardized schemes for 100+ active projects' fields, permissions, workflows
Enforced best practices and policies through configuration, automation, and behaviors
Created self-help pages, Slack channels for best practices and features
Coordinated SAML, SCIM, Azure AD changes for improved authentication
Deployed self-service Jira AIO add-on, enabled Power BI reports via AWS
Served as Scrum Master, facilitated Agile activities, sprint metrics, and roadmap plans
work.summary: As Senior System Admin for the Shared Services Tools Team, I managed critical apps and VM systems for Product Development and Delivery teams, handled user authorization, integration configuration, and toolset support. I ensured acceptance criteria aligned with security, architecture, and accessibility goals. Led Agile transformation and reduced technical debt. Implemented improvements and drove collaboration.

work.name: MAXIMUS sub. Omni
highlights: Managed Middleware, SecOps, Help Desk, Auth, TFA, TLS, SLA, DevOps tools
Supported primary app with 4,000 users 24/7/365
Standardized change management processes and environment procedures
Coordinated DBA and System admin cleanup efforts for continuous improvement
Improved legacy systems including Symantec TFA, TLS 1.2, and compliance
Managed Help Desk app, database, client reporting, SSIS coordination
Acted as Subject Matter Expert, collaborated across teams for DevOps and tools
Developed new apps, fulfilled automation needs, upgraded legacy tools
work.summary: Managed the Middleware group at the Dept of Education Debt Management System, supported 4,000 users 24/7/365. Led standardization, system improvements, and compliance efforts. Supported Help Desk, client reporting, and collaborated on cross-team initiatives. Developed new applications and enhanced toolsets for team efficiency and excellence.

work.name: MAXIMUS sub. Omni
highlights: ProdOps/24/7/ETL, Help Desk Admin, SOP/SLAs, Triage, SysAid, ReportsDB, SQL, SSMS, SSIS, HTML
work.summary:
As a Production Control Specialist (SME) and Help Desk Supervising Administrator (HDSA), I provided 24/7/365/99.999% support and site reliability engineering for our primary application, Debt Manager. In addition to normal production activities, I provided full development support to the Help Desk Operations team, including the design, testing, and implementation of new features and settings in a production environment.

Provided Production Control support and acted as subject matter expert for the DMCS Production Operations team, oversaw the operations of DBAs, Application, and System Administrators, as well as monitored the ETLs executing within the FICO Debt Management system. I also helped repair the reports database DSV & SMDL mappings for client reporting.

work.name: Xerox sub. Omni
highlights: ProdOps/24/7/ETL, JBOSS, SLAs, Reporting, Contract Transition
work.summary: Facilitated Production Control support and served as subject matter expert for the DMCS Production Operations team, oversaw the operations of DBAs, Application, and System Administrators for DMCS, as well as monitored the ETLs executing within the financial application. I documented and transitioned the contract procedures and policies to ensure a smooth transition to the next contract as an SME.

work.name: OmniSystems, Inc.
highlights: Worked on the DMCS contract as a subcontractor, consulted on internal projects and new business
work.summary: Acted as a key resource for Executive staff to use for IT projects and assignments. My responsibilities ranged from configuring an office WiFi-DMZ to initializing an internal Help Desk to centralize all IT SOP knowledge bases. I maintained the server room, including organizing equipment, analyzing power efficiency and usage reduction, and documenting the server room layout in Visio format. No task was too large or too small.

work.name: OmniSystems, Inc.
highlights: USVI: EDA Marketplace, Superior Court, Police Dept, Fire Services, WAPA, WICO, UVI.edu
Taught a former Lieutenant General to use iCloud, saved clients' wedding photos, and held executives accountable for insecure devices
work.summary: Acted as a key resource for Executive staff to use for IT projects and assignments. My responsibilities ranged from configuring an office WiFi-DMZ to initializing an internal Help Desk to centralize all our IT processes. I maintained the server room, including organizing equipment and improving power and airflow efficiency, as well as providing an analysis recommending system usage reduction, stratified by a documented layout of the server room in Visio format.

work.name: REAC-TAC Dept of HUD - sub:TomSawyerLLC
highlights: Housing and Urban Development
Remedy
Phone Support
Technical Training
work.summary: As Tier 1+ Help Desk Support, I trained call center staff and modified systems we used. My primary responsibilities included answering customer calls and providing remediation, ranging from password resets to data entry and status updates. This included further escalation to Tier 2 support teams for collaborative resolution.

work.name: REAC-TAC Dept of HUD - sub:CCSI
highlights: HUD, Remedy, Support
work.summary: Performed any assigned duties as a first tier Help Desk Support. My responsibilities included answering customer calls and providing remediation, which ranged from password resets to data entry and status updates, as well as further escalation to Tier 2 support teams.
